intro: Mollinedia sericiflora, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
